title: Former Assistant Government Analyst further remanded
summary: The Colombo Magistrate s Court has ordered the further remand of the former Assistant Government Analyst, who was arrested by the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) on corruption charges, until December 22. MORE..

title: Over 5,000 houses completely destroyed across Sri Lanka by Cyclone Ditwah
summary: The total number of houses completely destroyed across Sri Lanka due to the severe disaster situation caused by Cyclone Ditwah has surpassed 5,000, according to the latest report issued by the Disaster Management Centre (DMC). MORE..

title: Former Chairman of SLBFE Mohammed Hilmi granted bail
summary: The Colombo Magistrate s Court has ordered the release on bail of the former Chairman of the Sri Lanka Bureau of Foreign Employment (SLBFE), Mohammed Hilmi who was arrested by the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) in connection with an alleged corruption charge. MORE..

title: New Basnayake Nilame of Ruhunu Maha Kataragama Devalaya appointed
summary: Thilina Madushanka has been appointed as the Basnayake Nilame of the Ruhunu Maha Kataragama Devalaya, Ada Derana reporter said.

title: NBRO extends landslide warnings, identifies 15,000 high-risk areas
summary: The National Building Research Organisation (NBRO) reports that about 15,000 landslide-prone locations have been identified across the country, and nearly 5,000 families residing in those high-risk areas have already been relocated. MORE..

title: Indian Army speeds up bridge repairs, medical aid in Sri Lanka under Op Sagar Bandhu
summary: The Indian Army has stepped up its humanitarian assistance in Sri Lanka following Cyclone Ditwah, accelerating bridge restoration work and expanding medical support under Operation Sagar Bandhu. MORE..

title: Youth murdered with sharp weapon over financial dispute in Panadura
summary: A youth has been murdered with a sharp weapon in the Walana Road area of the Panadura South Police Division, according to police. MORE..

title: Irrigation Dept. lowers several reservoir water levels ahead of expected rainfall
summary: The Department of Irrigation reports that water levels in several major reservoirs across the country are being further reduced in response to rainfall forecasts for the coming days. MORE..

title: Trump warns of new tariffs on India, says they should not “Dump Rice” in US
summary: US President Donald Trump has warned that he may introduce new tariffs on agricultural imports, especially on rice imports from India and fertiliser from Canada, as trade talks with both countries continue without major progress. MORE..

title: Advisory issued for heavy rainfall above 100 mm
summary: The Department of Meteorology has issued an Amber advisory for heavy rainfall above 100 millimeters over the next 24 hours in parts of the island. MORE..

title: Measures implemented to register deaths of persons reported dead or missing after Cyclone Ditwah
summary: The Registrar General s Department of Sri Lanka has announced that the necessary legal provisions have been implemented to register the deaths of individuals who died or went missing due to landslides and floods caused by Cyclone Ditwah. MORE..

title: Level 3 (Red) landslide evacuation warning issued to several areas in four districts
summary: The Disaster Management Center (DMC) has instructed District Secretaries to evacuate people living in landslide-prone areas in the districts of Kandy, Kegalle, Kurunegala, and Matale to designated safe centers. MORE..

title: Trump urges Cambodia, Thailand to honour ceasefire as fighting reignites
summary: US President Donald Trump expects Cambodia and Thailand to “fully honor” their ceasefire commitments following renewed clashes along their disputed border that has forced thousands of people to flee, a senior administration official said on Monday (Dec 8). MORE..

title: Heavy rainfall expected in parts of the island today
summary: The Northeast monsoon conditions are gradually establishing over the island, the Department of Meteorology said. MORE..

title: Bandaranaike Foundation donates Rs. 250 million towards ongoing recovery efforts
summary: The Bandaranaike Memorial National Foundation has extended a financial contribution of Rs. 250 million towards national recovery efforts following the recent disaster. MORE..

title: Several people injured after 7.6-magnitude earthquake hits Japan
summary: Several people have sustained injuries at a hotel in the Aomori town of Hachinohe after a powerful 7. 6-magnitude earthquake struck off northern Japan on Monday. MORE..

title: India sends four additional warships to Sri Lanka with 1,000 tons of relief material
summary: The Indian Navy has deployed four more warships to support relief efforts in cyclone-hit regions of Sri Lanka as part of the ongoing Operation Sagar Bandhu, which aims to provide urgent Search Rescue (SAR) and Humanitarian Assistance Disaster Relief (HADR) aid. MORE..

title: Govt aims to ensure safety and security of every citizen – President
summary: The aim of the government is to ensure a safe life for every citizen and that it is everyone s responsibility to act with proper supervision during the resettlement of the people, according to President Anura Kumara Dissanayake. MORE..

title: Tsunami warning issued for Japan s east coast after 7.6-magnitude earthquake
summary: A tsunami warning has been issued for parts of Japan s east coast after a magnitude-7.6 earthquake struck off the coastline, according to Japan s Meteorological Agency. MORE..

title: Politicians obstruct Grama Niladhari officers from independently carrying out relief operations - Union
summary: The Grama Niladhari Officers Alliance has threatened to resort to trade union action if Grama Niladhari officers are continuously obstructed from carrying out their duties independently during the relief distribution process for those affected by the disaster. MORE..
